required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Arsenic Trioxide for Structural p53 Mutations
clinical_study.official_title: Targeting Structural p53 Mutations With Arsenic Trioxide for Intractable Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: TP53 is the most frequently mutated gene in cancer, but these mutations remain therapeutically non-actionable. Previous study reported arsenic trioxide could rescue structural p53 mutations, endowing p53 mutations with thermostability and transcriptional activity. Under Vivo and Vitro experiments, arsenic trioxide could reactivate mutated p53 to inhibit tumor. This trial aimed to explore the efficacy and safety of arsenic trioxide in refractory cancer patients with structural p53 mutations.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria through study completion, an average of 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with reduction in tumor burden of a predefined amount, including complete remission and partial remission

primary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria until first documented progress through study completion, an average of 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Time from treatment beginning until disease progression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of treatment beginning until the date of death from any cause, through study completion, an average of 1 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment beginning until death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 months

arm_group.description: Arsenic Trioxide (0.16mg/kg,d1-5,ivgtt,28days as a duration) for injection

intervention.description: Refractory cancer patients without standard-of-care harboring TP53 mutation received Arsenic Trioxide Injection (0.16mg/kg,d1-5,ivgtt,28days as a duration)

facility.name: Department of Medical Oncology, Shanghai Changzheng Hospital
